Description of incident: Items on display at a bankruptcy auction involving the Kitchen Place included two cabinets with customer information and shelved boxes with employee information.  Past customer credit card and bank account numbers, methods of payment and home floor plans were kept in the cabinets.  Shelves for sale carried boxes of employee information which included names, Social Security numbers and other personal and payroll information. Anyone looking over the auction items could have accessed the information.  At least one person purchased an item that held customer information and subsequently dumped the papers in the parking lot.
